page.title: 01The Area North of Durness
page.content: About two thirds of the block is sea. The land is a peninsular area of wild sand dunes surrounded bymainly rocky shores. The small portion of land in the extreme west of the block is restricted area. A road runs to a survey station at the end of the peninsula. The road suffers from sand blown onto it from the dunes a mechanical digger is on hand to clear it s required. Some livestock is grzed in the aera - sheep and cattle. In square 12 are derelict buildings, probably left from the last war.
